reviews.review_msg: Simply wonderful, made me very interested in SEA politics and inspired me to further my studies down that path. David is also such a caring and funny prof, he made classes so interesting with his jokes and engaging personality. I felt really comfortable asking him for help and he was very willing to do anything to help out. 10/10 recommend.

David is a great lecturer and really cares about IS and his students. He is flexible on due dates and wants you to do well, but really makes you work for your grade. Papers are marked quite hard, but it is not impossible to do well if you take your time. There is no midterm and he offers a good study guide for the final. Would recommend taking him!

David is a good prof who made a fairly boring subject quite interesting and engaging. Most of the grade is based on exams, so you need to make sure you study and know the material well (there is a lot of it!!)

David is a very fun loving professor, but he is really unclear with his responses. He does not give proper feedback at all. He is a really unpredictable professor. I had a very hard time with his expectations from the assignments. Would recommend a big no for him.

Dr. Matijasevich is by far the greatest professor I have had at Cap. He engages the class frequently and likes to ask the class questions and get their opinions on subjects, all while listening intently and giving insightful feedback. If you want to learn about politics he's your guy, makes it extremely fun and engaging.

David is super nice and a good teacher. He enjoys student participation and engages with all students questions and comments in a very open and genuine way which helps with student engagement in the coursework. He is also very knowledgeable and passionate about the political landscape in Southeast Asia and has interesting insight in this area.
Deserves tenure more than any other prof. Has changed my life with the knowledge acquired in his courses, best prof i have ever had

David teaches at CapU now. It was important to at least skim through the chapters or remember key points so you can participate by answering a couple of his questions. The class was graded by two separate short paragraphs written about a current event that relates to topics in the class. As well as a fair mid term and final. Favourite prof in 3 yrs
Worst experience ever, waste of money and time.

David is a super understanding and approachable professor. IS101 was a very straightforward class with a low level of difficulty, pretty much your perfect intro course and might have been the only course I've taken where I actually received valuable feedback on papers. 10/10 would recommend.

I love David! Absolutely incredible style of teaching! Super engaging and genuinely a nice guy. Political Science is not my strong suit, but he made the class fun and interesting. Would recommend him to anyone.

Could not have asked for a better first semester, first year, first university class prof. Challenges you to dive into topics, provides good feedback, is always up for a conversation about anything. Lectures are engaging and thorough. Checks in to make sure you're holding it together. Wish more Profs were like David

David is quite literally by far the best best best professor I have ever had at SFU!! His lectures are very very engaging, and he makes sure everyone understands the concepts within the material. He gives you lots of time to prepare before exams, and he gives you an amazing study guide! He is very funny, caring, and makes me want to come to class!
I love his non partisan style of teaching political science
David was absolutely phenomenal! Easily accessible by email and willing to setup zoom calls outside his office hours. Come to class ready to discuss and you'll learn a ton with him.

Awesome professor. The focus of classes were spread fairly evenly across the world (however, southeastern asia showed up the most often). Plenty of choice was given in terms of paper topics and the midterm and final exams were fair.
Really cultivates engagement in the class. Exceptionally knowledgeable and passionate about what he teaches.
Very engaging professor. He appreciates in-class participation

Is a great lecturer and well organized. 
The content of the course was set up you can retain & add knowledge as you go. The textbook was pretty enjoyable too.
Final exam was super fair, we got the questions in advance.
This is a good prof and course for IS majors, minors or others who need electives.

An outstanding professor who really wants his students to succeed, he is friendly and accessible outside of class. In-class discussions are flexible and interesting, he makes course material easy to learn if you engage with every lecture. The best professor I've ever had at SFU, don't miss the opportunity to take a class with him!

This is my third class with David and he continues to be an outstanding professor. He paid close attention to what worked for better in-class discussions and changed things along the way. Readings were good and he was always available during office hours and over email. Also very understanding with extensions and participation marks. 11/10.

An amazing prof, incredibly caring and a fair marker. David does an incredible job catering to each student's needs and makes himself available for non-course related things as well. I asked David to be an academic reference for me and he was more than happy to be one. The most caring prof, highly recommend.

David is a great guy! Ive only had him for a few classes but i can already tell he cares about his students. Classes are mandatory (but hes flexible with missing classes cause he has recorded lectures), his assignments are fair and actually help you learn a lot more by reading and researching for yourself as well. 10/10 funny guy, love the class!

David is an awesome prof. Very funny and genuinely cares about his students in the class. Tries to make things easier for students and is very helpful at the same time. Makes course material engaging and keeps it straightforward.

David is by far one of my favorite profs. He is very knowledgeable on what he teaches and it shows in how he explains concepts etc. Not only that, but he was also very open to suggestions from students as well. Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my time with David. If you see him as an option for one of your courses, then absolutely take it.

One of the best instructors I have ever had! The man not only knows how to teach but is an expert in emotional intelligence; he certainly has a gift for communication. Besides being honoured to have studied under the supervision of someone with his abilities, David has helped inspire me to publish my work and I am forever grateful. Recommended!!

Amazing professor! Took this course with him online and he was caring, kind, and extremely willing to help students. Due dates with him weren't strict at all, he was happy to let students submit late with no repercussion. Makes lectures super engaging and fun. Would absolutely take more classes with him, cannot recommend him enough.

This class was actually great to take remotely. David encouraged discussion during class, provided valuable insights, selected fascinating books, and provided awesome feedback on papers. Very kind and made sure to check in with students and be understanding of difficulites due to Covid. Please take a class with David, you won't regret it!

I honestly wish I had more time at SFU just so I could have more classes with David. Easily the best professor I've had in my whole undergrad. Very caring and considerate of his students. He's also super approachable if you need help, feedback, or just want to chat. Made online learning during COVID actually enjoyable and non-stressful.

The most incredible prof I've ever had in my 4 years of school. Genuinely cares and listens to his students, and is very knowledgeable. A good chunk of your mark is based on participation, but after reading the assigned pieces you'll have no issues with wanting to participate. Brb while I track down another course he's teaching.

David is super knowledgeable and one of the kindest professors Ive met at SFU. He emailed each of us in the middle of the term just to check in and see how were doing. The feedback he gave on our assignments are also really helpful and super detailed. He made IS451 as enjoyable as it can be and made the most out of our zoom sessions!
Tougher Marker, highly not recommended. Please wait until Next Term, he will RUIN YOUR GPA. His colleagues are much better in marking and teaching.

One of the best profs I've ever had. Incredibly chill, super approachable. Holds himself accountable for returning grades slightly late. Extended our essay due date by a week just based on the vibe he was getting. Did a check in throughout the semester to make sure we were doing ok. The Best. I'm enrolling in another course with him as I type
Took his class because of his good reviews and was not disappointed, model professor and also a great guy.
Best teacher ever.
David really wants his students to pass. He gives you all the resources you need to succeed, if you put some effort in his class is a GPA booster. Take his class!

David is an unreal prof, I would take any class with him in a heartbeat! His lectures are super informative and engaging, I was actually excited to come to class everyday. He is super knowledgeable and funny, he has very clear grading criteria, he gives very helpful feedback, and he is super approachable and kind. I cannot recommend David enough!!!

Id certainly take another class with David. He made theory sound fun! Great lecturer. Interesting take on democratic theory. Very clear about his expectations. Really wants his students to succeed. Very welcoming for questions. Quite accommodating. Overall, hes one of the best in the department.

David is such a great prof! He is friendly, funny and approachable. He ensures class is engaging and really makes the lectures engaging. He knows his stuff and encourages you to participate which is awesome!

David is a perfect example of a student's dream professor. While he is funny and lighthearted, he has a huge interest for the subject he teaches and ensures he does everything possible to help you succeed, whether it be extra office hours or extensions. He makes lectures very engaging and breaks down concepts very well. Definitely would take again!

David was one of the most caring professors I have ever had. He's kind, passionate and is very interactive and encourages discussion, as well as funny. For the main essay I was really overwhelmed with school and he totally understood and granted me a generous extension. B/c of him I want to pursue maybe a minor in poli sci or international studies.

Knowledgeable and well-versed on political science. Going to lecture was engaging and rewarding, and I would definitely consider taking other political science course with him even though its not my major. Only complaint is that his marking is a bit harder than most first year courses, but this pushes you to understand the material better.

David makes class so interesting and interactive. His lectures are more seminar based so you participate a lot but everything is super relevant and concepts are very clear by the end of lecture. He provides online office hours and is super quick at replying to emails and is always in his office ready to help.

The kindest professor I have ever had. Clearly wants his students to succeed and cares what everyone has to say. Extremely helpful and always goes the extra mile. Super knowledgeable and passionate about his subject matter. I would DEFINITELY take a class with him again!
